home.stepsTitle: Introduce noise into your statistics to protect privacy
home.stepsDescription: DP Creator allows researchers to easily introduce noise into variables masking specific details to keep private data private.
home.step1 text: Make sure your data is ready and appropriate to be processed with DP Creator by checking the Tips for Use, then create your account to get started.
home.step2 text: DP Creator works with a temporary copy of the first 20 variables of a file you send from a registered Dataverse data repository to create differentially private summary statistics from the variables you choose.
home.step3 text: DP Creator guides you through 4 steps: Confirm variables, Set epsilon value, Create statistics, Generate DP Release. You can save along the way, and have 72 hours to complete the release.
home.step4 text: After processing, review the release in DP Creator. When you're ready, submit the release to the referring Dataverse repository dataset for sharing and publication.
home.service1 title: Who should use this tool and why?
home.service1 text: DP Creator supports depositing restricted files to a registered Dataverse repository with differentially private statistics about those files that are open to anyone. You should not use DP Creator if sharing the data could cause severe harm (link to reference – FAQs?).
home.service2 title: What statistics can be released using this tool?
home.service2 text: Count, sum, mean, covariance, ... lorem ipsum dolor sit amet consectetur adipisicing elit. Animi iusto in, voluptas quia fugiat soluta labore consectetur harum repellendus accusamus
home.service3 text: Types of files... First 20 variables... Gaussian, Laplace, and Geometric algorithms applied to common statistics... epsilon and delta...variables you select will be released with noise for privacy protection. Link to find out more
home.service4 title: What can be done with the DP Release?
home.service4 text: A DP release includes 3 files; a .pdf and machine readable JSON and XML formats. These files are deposited back to the Dataverse repository installation and are published as part of the original dataset. They provide a sense of what's in the data. (Add: can it be cited? etc)
home.checkbox: I have read the tips for use
home.footer title: This is a sentence about Open DP
home.footer text: OpenDP is a community effort to build trustworthy, open-source software tools for statistical analysis of sensitive private data. These tools offer the rigorous protections of differential privacy for the individuals who may be represented in confidential data and statistically valid methods of analysis for researchers who study the data.

confirm variables.confirm variables intro: First, review, adjust and confirm the variables. These will be considered in the generation of the differential privacy release. Consider adjusting if... To adjust, set a reasonable, approximate range depending on the variable's type in the table below.
confirm variables.help variable: E.g. Numerical: minX - max: Y; Categorical: cat1,cat2,cat3
confirm variables.help type: Type is inferred when data is imported. If it is not inferred correctly, cancel the release, and edit the original file.

set epsilon.epsilon intro: Epsilon is a metric of privacy loss. The smaller the value is, the better the privacy protection. To determine the epsilon value, we need to confirm your dataset's characteristics with some questions about the sample.
set epsilon.help epsilon: Epsilon is a metric of privacy loss at a differentially change in data (adding, removing 1 entry). The smaller the value is, the betterprivacy protection.
set epsilon.help data secret: For example, information about persons, their behavior, beliefs and attributes is generally private information that individuals inthe dataset would not want publicly shared in their name and should be marked “yes”. Information that is solely about instituons,corporations, natural phenomena, etc., that are public record and can be publicly distributed, does not depend on privateinformation.
set epsilon.help data public: For example, the number of observations in a dataset containing a 5% sample of California voters is public, but the number of observations in a dataset containing all cancer patients in a particular hospital may not be public, as it could be combined with auxiliary information to reveal whether or not a patient has cancer.

create statistics.statistics intro: Create the statistics you would like to release. Confirm the default levels or edit them to change the degree of noise or interference you'd like to add. The default values distribute epsilon evenly across variables.
create statistics.more info 1-3: Where should these links go? (or one link in the epsilon warning, below?)
create statistics.epsilon warning: Changing the epsilon, delta, or confidence level will directly impact the privacy settings. Every DP statistic has a different tradeoff between epsilon value and accuracy. Splitting the budget evenly can diminish the usefulness of statistics. More complex statistics will generally require more budget. Link to more info
create statistics.statistics help: You can apply different statistics to single or multiples variables. Then, you can edit these statistics, lock them or delete them so that changes...
create statistics.help epsilon: (Not in the AM files but needed?)
create statistics.help error: Error is the measure of uncertainty for the statistic.
create statistics.edit epsilon warning: Are you sure? Changing the epsilon, delta, or confidence level will directly impact the privacy settings.
create statistics.confirm 1: The recommended values below are based upon your dataset type selection
create statistics.confirm 2: Note: Larger X corresponds to larger privacy loss budget, and hence, less privacy.We do not recommend X exceding 1.
create statistics.confirm 3: Note: X is the probability of a blatant privacy violation. X values larger than the reciprocal of the dataset size are not allowed.
create statistics.confirm 4: The level of privacy protection for individuals in the dataset is governed by two privacy-loss parameters - x & x.

generate DP.generate text: The final step is to submit the statistics and generate the differential privacy release. This will finalize the current selections and spend your allocated privacy budget on them.
generate DP.generate status: (Include a summary of the statistics being requested/work to be done. The equivalent of reviewing a shopping cart before confirming the order. Note this is missing from the Agile Monkeys files, but is in the Miro file)
